item.title: Diffie Hellman
item.description: I’ve written this article while I was untanging RSA and Deffie Hellman inside my head. What I need to stree right here, in the article description, the main difference between them is the Deffie Hellman is NOT a encryption algorithm!

item.title: Randomness
item.description: In this article I am assembling information about randomness in computer science: how it is implemented, used and how it can be attacked.

item.title: RSA
item.description: To my utter embarrassment I had to admit that I’ve recently realized I didn’t remember how the RSA worked….

item.title: AES
item.description: is the next generation. 128 bit blocks, 128,192, 256 keys. Takes too much time to bruteforce.

item.title: DES
item.description: DES - Symmetric. Data Encryption Standard. NIST 1993. 56 bit key, 64-bit plaintext input (blocks). How secure?
